weekly_top_story.headline: Federal Government Shutdown Disrupts Key Healthcare Services and Policies
weekly_top_story.summary: The government shutdown that began October 1, 2025, has caused significant disruptions to healthcare programs including the expiration of pandemic-era Medicare telehealth flexibilities and the halting of hospital-at-home services, creating challenges for providers and patients.

stories.headline: Central Government Health Scheme Revises Package Rates for Empanelled Healthcare Organisations
stories.summary: Effective October 13, 2025, the Central Government Health Scheme has introduced revised treatment package rates for healthcare organisations aiming for uniformity and rationalisation in costs, impacting reimbursements and service provisions.

stories.headline: White House Continues Push to Lower Drug Prices Amidst Legislative Gridlock
stories.summary: With drug pricing high on the agenda during ongoing federal funding disputes, the White House announced plans and policies aiming to reduce drug costs despite government shutdown challenges.
